definition: A designated area on a road, typically marked with alternating black and white parallel lines, used to facilitate the safe crossing of pedestrians. It is commonly found near intersections or busy streets, allowing pedestrians to cross from one side to the other while vehicles yield.

examples.german: Der Zebrastreifen ist eine Markierung auf der Straße.
examples.english: The zebra crossing is a marking on the road.

examples.german: Bitte überqueren Sie die Straße nur am Zebrastreifen.
examples.english: Please only cross the road at the zebra crossing.

examples.german: Der Autofahrer hielt an, um die Fußgänger am Zebrastreifen passieren zu lassen.
examples.english: The driver stopped to let the pedestrians pass at the zebra crossing.

examples.german: Der Zebrastreifen ist gelb und schwarz gestreift.
examples.english: The zebra crossing is yellow and black striped.

examples.german: Kinder sollten lernen, den Zebrastreifen sicher zu überqueren.
examples.english: Children should learn to cross the zebra crossing safely.
